summary: The document is a segment of the JFK Assassination System records, focusing on an identification form concerning DOD-affiliated personnel incident investigations. It outlines a local agency check and an FBI report on Manuel Marti, a US Army private from San Juan, Puerto Rico. The FBI's New York office reported no additional information on Marti beyond what was previously shared with the 108th Military Intelligence Group regarding Marti's father. Originally classified, the document was released with deletions on March 7, 1995.
key_findings: The document pertains to the JFK Assassination System and involves investigations into incidents related to DOD-affiliated personnel.
It details a local agency check and an FBI report on Manuel Marti, revealing no further information was available beyond details related to his father.
Initially classified, the document was later released with certain deletions on March 7, 1995.
